benchmark_details.name: Knowledge Hierarchy Guided Biological-Medical Dataset Distillation
benchmark_details.overview: The KAILIN framework automates the distillation of high-quality textual training data from extensive scientific literature for biomedical applications, generated through a knowledge hierarchy guided approach using Medical Subject Headings (MeSH).

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: Develop a high-quality, automatically generated dataset for training language models in biomedical Q&A tasks.

data.source: 23 million abstracts collected from PubMed and open-source annotated datasets.
data.annotation: Automatically generated through the KAILIN framework

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the evaluation of the model's performance on the PubMedQA benchmark.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better understanding and alignment with biomedical knowledge hierarchy.
methodology.baseline_results: KAILIN framework enables LLaMA-3-70B to outperform GPT-4 on PubMedQA.
methodology.validation: Deep evaluations made using ablation studies and case analyses.
